alert.note: Alert for Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 01 at 2:38PM EDT until September 01 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, Jackson and Washington. * WHEN...Until 445 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 137 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vernon, Chipley, Bonifay, Graceville, Bradford, Cottondale, Alford, Wausau, Campbellton, Sunny Hills, Orange Hill, Chipley Municipal Airport, Gilberts Mill, Brock Crossroad, Bahoma, Poplar Head, Richter Crossroads, Johnson Crossroads, Steele City and Spring Hollow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
